results.title: Elements
results.brief_description: This program tracks the journey of Western Australia’s natural gas from the North Rankin “A” Gas and Condensate production platform, through its 134 km journey to the Burrup Peninsula and through the liquefication process, concluding with delivery to Japan. The video explains various elements of the LNG plant including the sulfinol column, dehydration unit, scrub column, heat exchanger, storage tanks and control room. The program concludes with details of the LNG ships and their delivery of LNG to Japanese power utilities.

results.title: Elementary mathematics for teachers and students: games
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and General Learning Corporation
results.brief_description: An animated film for in-service work and the classroom. Two strategy games are played, one of co-ordinates, the second where two players take turns to erase a specified number of marks. Once the children have learnt these games they can progress to other games related to “rim”, eg games that use matches, or boardgames with counters. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Elementary experiments in the chemistry of water
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the following elementary experiments which illustrate the chemistry of water. 1. Exploding one part of oxygen with two parts of hydrogen to form water. 2. Passing an electric current through pure water and salt solution. 3. Burning hydrogen to form water vapour. 4. Electrolysis of water.

results.title: Elegant girl or the drive for reliability
results.brief_description: A musical advertisement for the Vauxhall motor car. Makes a technical comparison between vintage and later model cars and shows the detailed testing the modern Vauxhall goes through to ensure its all-round quality and performance is at a maxiumum.

results.title: Electrostatics II
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Deals with electromagnetic induction, a single turn generator, modern large power stations, the transmission of electricity, currents in electrical equipment, ring mains, electromagnetic damping and forces on conductors. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Electrostatics I
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Deals with Coulombic attraction and repulsion, Perrin’s tube, the charge on electrons, electrostatic charges on carpets, xerography, electrostatic precipitation, electrostatic charge on liquids, electrostatic generators, lightning conductors and capacitors. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Electrostatic charges and forces
results.brief_description: This film shows how positive and negative charges are created: defines such basic concepts as insulator, conductor and electric field; and introduces Coulomb’s law, used to measure electrostatic charges. A laboratory demonstration of Faraday’s ice-pail experiment is presented. The film also shows how the principles of electrostatic charges and forces can be used to explain the operation of the Van de Graaff generator.

results.title: Electrons in harness
results.creator_credit: David Cons, Seafield Head and Verity Films
results.brief_description: The film is set in a modern electronics research laboratory where work is seen being carried out on, for example, electron beam machining, high vacuum techniques, cathode ray tubes and microcircuits. The relation between research and production is illustrated, and the end sequence illustrates the many fields in which electronics play a vital part including medicine, telecommunication and defence.

results.title: Electrons and electronics: an introduction
results.brief_description: Explains how such electronic devices as vacuum tubes and transistors work and how they are put to use in the fields of communication, transportation, medicine and industry. A visit to a broadcasting station shows us what part electronics plays in radio and television.
